author: news24.com
title: No mercy for John Block
text:
The National Prosecuting Authority (NPA) will ask the Northern Cape High Court in Kimberley to sentence John Block to 15 years in jail.
Block, who resigned as Northern Cape ANC chairperson on Friday, was found guilty of corruption and money laundering on Wednesday after a 20-month trial.
NPA Northern Cape spokesperson Mashudu Malabi-Dzhangi confirmed yesterday: “The intention of the NPA is to ask for the maximum sentence prescribed by the law.
“However, the discretion on whether to impose the maximum sentence lies with the presiding officer after listening to both the mitigating and aggravating circumstances. It is possible for the presiding officer to order that the sentences on the corruption and money laundering charges be ordered to run concurrently.”
